meeting_annotations.transcript: So I guess I I would throw in a pitch for one of the things that I heard in in because I was trying to ask the question is that even in this world of machine learning and data science that we still want to extract new physics new physics or new knowledge perspectives at at the scales that we don't have access to whether that's the middle scales or whatever you want to call it and that there's still room for that. I also heard some people saying that there was room for modeling for for whether it's a whole cell or a whole organism or and and then using those models from which to extract new insight and and that that it's not like at the exclusion of the other.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Rigoberto Hernandez, Johns Hopkins
meeting_annotations.transcript: They're both two different types of theorists and sometimes the same human being can have more than one hat and and and I've argued for a long time that in the theory and computational world that there was there was already a dichotomy that was emerging early on which was the theory and the modelers and the modelers needed to know theory and they were not experimentalists but a model is a kind of a numerical experiment and so they're another breed and there are people who just live in that space.
